title: Bug 3666 - CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Under certain circumstances, code assist eats too much code. When adding a parameter to the `baz` call in `bar` to make the program correct, the code is changed incorrectly. Instead of giving `baz(x.foo().foo())`, it should give `baz(x.foo(), x.foo())`.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Change the `baz` call to `baz(x.x.foo())`.
2. Place the cursor after the first `x.`.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type `f` to filter the list.
5. Select `foo()`.
6. Verify that the code completion suggests `baz(x.foo(), x.foo())`.
OB:
The code is changed to:

```
baz(x.foo()x.foo())
```

Instead of giving:

```
baz(x.foo(), x.foo())
```

The code assist is eating too much code.
EB:
The code is changed to:

```
baz(x.foo(), x.foo())
```

Instead of giving:

```
baz(x.foo()x.foo())
```

The code assist should not eat any additional code.
SR: Change the `baz` call to `baz(x.x.foo())`. Place the cursor after the first `x.`. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist. Type `f` to filter the list. Select `foo()`. Verify that the code completion suggests `baz(x.foo(), x.foo())`.
